title: San Francisco/Golden Gate
name: Clay Theater
directions: between Clay St and Sacramento St
price: General: $10.50 Bargain Matinee: $8.00 (M-F before 6PM, Sa-Su 1st showing)
content: The Art Deco/Neo-Classical Clay Theater was built in 1910 and is one of the oldest movie theaters in the city. It specializes in indie and international films.  It's a small little theater, with smallish seats and an even smaller screen; but its got a cozy atmosphere, its popcorn comes laden with butter, and overall it's a great place to catch an art house film.
